title: Worms from Watergate: When Richard Nixon wanted China to fight India-Pakistan War
description: ​When Bernard asks why, Sir Humphrey explains: “Because once the Prime Minister knows, there will have to be an enquiry, like Watergate. The investigation of a trivial break-in led to one ghastly revelation after another and finally the downfall of a president. The golden rule is don’t lift lids off cans of worms. Everything is connected to everything else.”

Senior stars Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are in Grade B, signalling a shift toward younger players and a new phase in Indian cricket.

title: Are colleges teaching the skills Gen Z needs for today’s workplace?
description: Gen Z is questioning whether college is still the place where work readiness is built. Deloitte’s 2025 Gen Z and Millennial Survey shows what the budding workforce say is missing: Practical exposure, job-relevant curricula, and basic AI fluency. Work now rewards judgement, teamwork, and fast adaptation. Gen Z is, therefore, building employability through experience, feedback, and self-skilling beyond campus.

Her decisive win signals a more assertive Japan on the global stage, impacting regional dynamics.

title: Russian crude imports to be cut by half? India lays out approach amid trade deal with US
description: On its part the Trump administration has claimed that India has committed to ending both direct and indirect imports of oil from the Russian Federation. The executive order by Trump says that the tariffs on Indian exports to the US could be increased if such crude imports resume.

title: Who leaked ex-army chief Naravane's book? Delhi cops file case as digital copy goes viral
description: Rahul Gandhi's insistence on reading purported extracts from the yet-to-be-published Naravane's book shone the spotlight on the rules and regulations that restrict senior military officials from revealing classified information or crucial leadership decisions even after retirement. The book was slated to hit the stands in January 2024, but the Army and the defence ministry asked the publisher not to go ahead until they had reviewed its contents.

This move signifies Armenia's diversification of arms procurement, seeking alternatives to Soviet and Russian equipment. The deal, valued at $250 million, underscores India's growing role as a defence exporter.

description: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi criticized the BJP and RSS for advocating the Bharat Ratna for V.D. Savarkar, suggesting they might even award it to Mahatma Gandhi's assassin, Nathuram Godse. Owaisi cited the J.L. Kapur Commission report, which identified Savarkar as a conspirator in Gandhi's assassination, and highlighted Maulvi Alauddin as the first prisoner at Cellular Jail, not an RSS member.

The move comes amid rising Windows 11 bugs, underwhelming Copilot adoption, and growing evidence that AI-generated code introduces more errors than it eliminates.

Starmer on way out? How Epstein revelations could lead to UK's first Muslim prime minister
description: Starmer is not accused of misconduct, and Mandelson has consistently denied any impropriety. Yet British politics does not operate solely on legal thresholds. It operates on perception, timing and instinct. The renewed attention on Epstein has revived a broader unease about elite networks, proximity to power and the sense that some figures are insulated from consequences. In that climate, Mandelson’s return has become a liability rather than an asset, raising uncomfortable questions not about guilt, but about judgement.

title: Punjab campus horror: Law student kills girl classmate, then turns gun on himself
description: A shocking murder-suicide unfolded at Usma Law College in Tarn Taran, where a first-year student fatally shot her classmate before taking his own life. Both students, Sandeep Kaur and Prince Raj Singh, were in their first semester. Authorities are investigating the motive, reviewing CCTV footage and witness statements to understand the tragic incident that has left the campus reeling.

title: Kim Kardashian vs Lewis Hamilton: Who is richer amid dating rumours?
description: Kim Kardashian and Lewis Hamilton’s recent public appearances have fueled dating rumors and sparked interest in their massive wealth. Kardashian leads financially with an estimated $2 billion net worth driven by Skims. Hamilton, worth about $450 million, earns through racing, endorsements, and investments. Together, their combined net worth exceeds $2.4 billion.

title: 'Staff kept incident hidden for hrs': Newborn charred to death in Kanpur hospital fire
description: A newborn girl tragically perished in a fire that erupted in the NICU of Raja Hospital in Kanpur's Bithoor area. The blaze, reportedly caused by a short circuit, engulfed the infant's bed. Hospital staff allegedly concealed the incident for hours before the distressed parents were informed, leading to a chaotic scene and police intervention.

title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers eye $186m Bucks star to join LeBron & Doncic
description: Trade speculation is intensifying around the Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo in the 2026 offseason. A hypothetical framework involves a package of Austin Reaves, Rui Hachimura, Dalton Knecht, Adou Thiero, and multiple future draft picks. This move would create a star-studded trio with LeBron James and Luka Dončić, aiming for immediate championship contention.

title: Travis Kelce felt 'awkward' with Blake Lively & Ryan Reynolds, reports say
description: As Taylor Swift deals with probably being called to court after her controversial text exchange with Blake Lively was made public, it seems Travis Kelce was never fond of their company. Just a few hours ago, an insider has claimed that Travis Kelce reportedly felt uncomfortable while hanging out with the Hollywood power couple and is now pretty concerned about Taylor Swift.

title: Brittany Mahomes gets emotional over Matthew Stafford’s MVP family tribute
description: Matthew Stafford captured his first AP MVP award after a standout season with the Rams, but it was his family tribute that stole the spotlight. Joined by his four daughters, Stafford became emotional during a touching message calling him a dad first. Brittany Mahomes reacted online, writing, “Okay crying omg,” showing heartfelt support for the moment.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
description: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." Employees seek transparency on contracts, a Q&A session, and protection for all workers, calling for an end to complicity in government actions.
